name: perfect fit toe-up socks - (fing., faux heel flap)
notes:
**finally — a toe-up sock pattern that fits like your favorite cuff-down heel flap socks**, but without the tricky picking up of stitches.

these faux heel flap socks mimic the classic look and feel of a top-down heel flap — complete with the option for textured heel stitches (like eye of partridge) and contrasting-color heels. but because the heel flap is worked seamlessly into the sock, you get all the style and fit benefits without the hassle.

**why knitters love this pattern:**
	•	high instep options: clear instructions for regular, high, and very high insteps so your socks always fit.
	•	contrasting heels made easy: knit sock-monkey style or bold colorblock heels (rare in most toe-up designs).
	•	textured heel stitches: add durability and interest with classic slip-stitch or eye of partridge heels.
	•	two-at-a-time ready: instructions written so you can knit both socks at once on magic loop.
	•	video support: includes a free video lesson walking you through the faux heel flap step.

knitters say these socks are their go-to toe-up pattern because they combine the perfect fit of a heel flap with the ease of toe-up construction.

written for fingering weight yarn and written row-by-row, this pattern will quickly become your favorite way to knit socks.

**pattern notes**
	•	written for toe-up construction using magic loop (2 circulars or dpns can be adapted).
	•	includes detailed instructions for customizing instep fit: regular, high, and very high insteps.
	•	faux heel flap is worked seamlessly into the sock (no picking up stitches required).
	•	options for contrasting-color heels and textured heel stitches (eye of partridge, slip-stitch heel).
	•	pattern includes links to free knitfreedom video tutorials for each step of the process.
	•	can be worked one or two socks at a time.

⸻

**skills needed**
	•	basic toe-up sock techniques (judy’s magic cast-on - free video provided).
	•	increases (m1r and m1l - free video provided).
	•	short rows (wrap & turn or german short rows, free videos provided).
	•	working in the round with magic loop (preferred - free video provided) or dpns.
	•	optional: using 2 colors for contrasting heels.
	•	reading written instructions (charts not required).

**yarn + materials:**
	•	fingering weight sock yarn (approx. 350–400 yds for women’s medium)
	•	us size 2 (2.75 mm) needles (magic loop or dpns)
	•	stitch markers, tapestry needle

sizing:
**finished measurements:**
sizes: small (medium, large) 
foot circumference: 7(8,9) in [18(20,23) cm]
length: customizable to exact foot length
insteps: standard (high instep, very high instep)
